Global Commercial Aircraft Cabin Interiors Market: Forecast Until 2019 – Increase in Number of Aircraft a Market Driver Published
The commercial aircraft cabin interior consists of lights, seats, windows, windshields, IFEC, galley and the toilet. The design of lights, seats, color combinations and other value add-ons boost the overall look of an aircraft’s interior. The interior of an aircraft cabin is designed to enhance passenger comfort and airline service. Despite rising fuel prices, there has been an increase in global air travel and growth in passengers’ investment appetite. Moreover, the passenger experience is a key differentiator used by airlines to attract and retain customers.
One of the major trends is cabin customization aims to provide an improved passenger in-flight experience through the introduction of innovatively designed cabins that meet customers’ needs. This is a key competitive differentiator in the global commercial aircraft cabin interior market.
According to the report, One of the major trends in the market is air travel has become very convenient and comfortable for passengers around the globe because of the installation of interactive windows, emergence of wireless IFEC, and introduction of lightweight seats, as well as the development of customized cabins.
Further, the report states that the major challenge is the redesigning of old aircraft seats according to modern-day specifications with the use of advanced technology and lightweight materials is highly intensive in terms of time, capital, and technical expertise. It is difficult to refurbish an old interior product of an aircraft cabin as it requires thorough research and high investment.
